retail.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else
retail.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The retail value would be around $500.
Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
a manager with twenty years’ experience in the retail business
We are looking for more retail outlets for our products.
retail.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to be sold for a particular price in a shop
retail.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
The decoder is expected to retail for under $300.
retail.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Their products are retailed all over Britain.
retail.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to give other people private information about someone or something
retail.translation[3].definitions[0].def: if you buy or sell something retail, you buy or sell it in a shop
retail.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: We only deal with wholesalers – we don’t sell any of our goods retail.
retail.translation[4].definitions[0].def: the sale of goods to customers for their own use, rather than to shops etc
retail.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: His experience in retail includes managing a number of shopping centres in New Zealand.
The Potato Marketing Board determines the size range of potatoes which can be offered for retail.
retail.translation[4].definitions[1].def: the selling of goods or services to members of the public, or companies involved in this
retail.translation[4].definitions[1].exa: Anyone working in the retail trade will often have to deal with customers who want to exchange or return goods.
retail.translation[4].definitions[2].def: a shop etc that is open to members of the public
retail.translation[4].definitions[2].exa: These large retail outlets stock a wide range of goods.
retail.translation[4].definitions[3].def: banking or investment services available to members of the public, rather than to businesses or companies
retail.translation[4].definitions[4].def: an individual customer etc, rather than a business or company
retail.translation[4].definitions[4].exa: The scheme relates to all new cars sold to retail customers.
retail.translation[5].definitions[0].def: to be sold to the public, usually in shops, for a particular price
retail.translation[5].definitions[0].exa: The doll will retail for about £36.
retail.translation[5].definitions[1].def: to sell goods in small quantities to members of the public, usually in a shop
retail.translation[5].definitions[1].exa: The product is not being retailed through the right kind of outlets.
retail.translation[6].definitions[0].def: if something is sold retail, it is sold to members of the public, usually in a shop
retail.translation[6].definitions[0].exa: We only deal with wholesalers - we don’t sell any of our goods retail.
